title: Bellangelo 2014 Dry Riesling (Seneca Lake)
description: Earthy whiffs of smoke and dust lend a savory tone to this dry light-bodied wine. The palate is quite zesty, offering crisp apple and pear flavors against a piercing backdrop of lemon-lime acidity. The moderately long finish is refreshingly mineral in tone.

title: Billsboro 2014 Sawmill Creek Vineyards Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Dusty mineral and bramble notes lend a rustic feel to freshly pressed apple and pear flavors here. Semidry in style, its sweet-tart pineapple midpalate is lively and fresh. The finish is long, accented by delicate tea tannins.

title: Billsboro 2015 Sawmill Creek Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)
description: Green and invigorating peppery tones accent this lemony Sauvignon Blanc. It's not a deeply complex penetrating wine but is vivaciously fresh through the finish.

title: Vesevo 2016 Falanghina (Beneventano)
description: Tropical fruit and honeysuckle aromas lead the nose and carry over to the palate, along with hints of banana and yellow pear. The finish is laced with orange zest.

title: Castillo De Feliciana 2015 Brillánte Brut Sparkling Wine Méthode Traditionnelle Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: All Chardonnay, this wine brings aromas of the underside of a pineapple along with apple and tropical-fruit notes. The flavors show the warmth of the vintage and bring a bit more sweetness than often seen on a brut.
designation: Brillánte Brut Sparkling Wine Méthode Traditionnelle

title: Château Bellevue la Forêt 2016 L'Allégresse Rosé (Fronton)
description: Mainly made from the local star Négrette, this is a rounded ripe wine. It has spice and attractive caramel flavors as well as plenty of fruity acidity. Made to drink young, it is ready for the summer.

title: Château Coutinel 2016 Braucol (Comté Tolosan)
description: In an interesting homage to the Gaillac region, this Fronton producer has made a 100% Braucol from its estate near Toulouse. It is a structured wine, although the main characters are piercing red fruits and delicious acidity. This is a wine to drink young from early 2018.

title: Château Coutinel 2016 Malbec (Comté Tolosan)
description: One of a pair of wines from this producer paying homage to neighboring regions, this wine references the Malbec of Cahors. It is softer than some Malbecs, bringing out the grape's fruitiness and acidity rather than its structure. That makes it a candidate for drinking young, starting from early 2018.

title: Château de Brigue 2016 Signature Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: In the Brigue range, this is the entry-level wine. With its attractive fruits and lively acidity, the wine is easy and crisp. It has a clean pure red-fruit flavor that makes it refreshing and ready to drink.

title: Château du Carrubier 2016 Cuvée d'Aurore Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The entry-level rosé from this estate, close to the Mediterranean Sea, is bright and breezy. It has a herbal edge as well as plenty of acidity and a crisp texture. The aftertaste has spice as well as plenty of fruitiness.

title: Bodegas Murviedro 2013 Cepas Viejas Bobal (Utiel-Requena)
description: Berry and earth aromas open with a touch of horseradish that blows off with time. This Bobal is drawing and dry on the palate, with fresh acidity. Savory berry and tomato flavors finish with scratchy tannins.

title: Bohigas 2015 X Xarel-lo (Catalunya)
description: Light aromas of mango, melon and lime are quiet but clean. This is a simple but fresh white with a crisp stony mouthfeel. Easygoing flavors of melon and apple finish with a note of lime as well as a hint of wheaty yeast.

title: Château le Payral 2016 Sauvignon-Sémillon-Muscadelle White (Bergerac Sec)
description: The wine with its hint of herbal fruit and delicious lightly perfumed character is one to drink young. There is a crisp edge although the main part of this wine is its fruitiness and floral character. Drink now.

title: Chateau Peyrassol 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: There is a light pepper and spice character that comes through in this wine. It adds to the wine's simple fruitiness with complexity, pushing the rosé into a food friendly character. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Collier Falls 2013 Hillside Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Tart cherry flavor meets firm tannins and chalky texture in this robust, ripe and brawny red. Full bodied and richly concentrated, it holds its ripeness in check.

title: CVNE 2014 Viña Real Crianza  (Rioja)
description: A somewhat flat baked jammy nose offers up a helping dose of oak spice. This feels chunky but largely healthy, while oaky minty flavors of berry fruits and plum show a tomato-like quality on a blocky finish.

title: Domaine D'en Ségur 2015 Syrah-Duras Red (Côtes du Tarn)
description: This producer, based in the Tarn valley east of Cahors, has created a rounded, ripe and fruity wine. With some young tannins still in evidence, it is all about berry fruits and balanced acidity. The structure will soften over the next few months, so drink this attractively fruity wine from late 2017.

title: Domaine des Fouques 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence La Londe)
description: This is a round full style of rosé. As a result, it is also soft and rich. The balance between the ripe strawberry fruits and the crisper acidity is just right. Drink this wine now.

title: Layer Cake 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Lively peach, papaya and squeezed lime aromas show on the jubilant nose of this bottling. The palate is equally energetic, with pink grapefruit and strawberry flavors, perfect for poolside or beach day quaffing.

title: Vionta 2015 Limited Release Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: As this enters its second year in bottle, the nose is still clean and punchy, much like fruit salad. A plump solid mouthfeel holds flavors of salty peach. Beyond that, there's not a lot to say about this standard Albariño. Drink immediately.

title: Tertulia 2012 Phinny Hill Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Brooding aromas of spice box, herb, purple fruit and wood spice are followed by medium-bodied cranberry flavors. The tannins bring a sense of astringency, requiring some time in the cellar to (hopefully?) soften.

title: Tertulia 2016 Elevation Estate Vineyard Marsanne (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Aged in stainless steel, this wine comes from a new wine-growing region in the cataracts of the North fork of the Walla Walla River. The aromas are quite faint initially. The palate is on the lighter side of medium bodied, with tart flavors. It lacks a sense of clear direction.

title: Thomas Carteron 2016 L'Excellence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Proudly claiming to be a blend of eight grape varieties, this wine is soft and gently fruity with a spicy background that gives it a bitter edge. That will blow off in a few months, so drink this food friendly wine from late 2017.

title: Ponga 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Another impressive bargain-priced 2015 Sauvignon Blanc. Consumers looking for summer 2017 refreshment should grab some of this for its crisp flavors of pineapple, passion fruit and grapefruit. Drink now.

title: Phelps Creek 2014 Becky's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (OR))
description: A stiffly tannic wine, this seems to have a hard shell around the fruit. Rhubarb and strawberry flavors poke through, with a savory note running through the finish.

title: Tormaresca 2016 Calafuria Negroamaro Rosato (Salento)
description: Red berry, violet and a whiff of clove lead the nose. Bright and fruity, the refreshing palate doles out crushed raspberry, wild cherry and a savory note of pink peppercorn.

title: Trivento 2016 White Orchid Reserve Torrontés (Mendoza)
description: Tropical aromas are a tiny bit grassy and oily. In the mouth, this is acidic and tangy, while lime and green-herb flavors are snappy. Crisp citric acidity creates sizzle on a racy finish.

title: Winzerkeller Andau 2016 Blaufränkisch Rosé (Burgenland)
description: This wine opens with a touch of fleshy ripeness. The palate is expansive, brimming with fresh red berry notes. Light in body, it finishes with uplifting lemon.

title: Wilson 2014 Carl's Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Vanilla, cherry and raspberry flavors are complemented by smoky meat and tar in this softly built, mellow and pensively sweet wine that's ripe and generous in body.

title: Airfield Estates 2015 Viognier (Yakima Valley)
description: Aromas of tangerine zest, peach and flower are followed by dry clean fruit flavors that show no apparent oak influence, with citrus notes lingering on the finish.
